title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 December 2015 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <Ramona1> has quit  
10:27 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <martinus\_\_> hi all, what would happen to existing attachements if I turn file attachement versioning to OFF on a xwiki instance ?  
10:54 <cjd> they stay as files so they will be broken  
10:57 <martinus\_\_> cjd, hi and thanks ! if they stay as files why would they be broken ?  
11:01 <vmassol1> maven part of the release done. Now starting paperwork  
11:01 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:02 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: I think it simply means that when you navigate to an attachment on a wiki page and you try to access it, it'll fail  
11:02 <vmassol> since xwiki won't find it in the DB  
11:03 <vmassol> in other words, I don't think we have a script to copy file attachments to the DB ATM  
11:03 <vmassol> (we have one for the other way around only)  
11:03 <martinus\_\_> my question is about versionning, not filesystem/db  
11:03 <martinus\_\_> about xwiki.store.attachment.versioning=0  
11:03 <vmassol> ah yes sorry  
11:04 <martinus\_\_> hi vmassol btw :)  
11:04 <vmassol> there's no cleanup in the DB  
11:04 <cjd> oh hah sorry, I totally didn't read what you said correctly  
11:04 <cjd> ignore me :)  
11:04 <vmassol> so existing attachment history will still be in the DB  
11:05 <vmassol> but new attachment won't get any history  
11:05 <vmassol> \*attachments  
11:05 <cjd> Well it's \*file\* attachment versioning, if you switch to 0 then there will be versions of attachments remaining on the FS  
11:05 <vmassol> the UI may not show history for previous attachments though, I don't really know  
11:05 <cjd> but they will not get in the way, just use some space  
11:06 <vmassol> ah yes sorry again, FS ;)  
11:06 <vmassol> but same rule  
11:06 <cjd> Everyone could use a holiday, we all managed to misread the phrase :)  
11:06 <vmassol> :)  
11:06 <martinus\_\_> lol !  
11:06 <martinus\_\_> not FS in my case but DB :)  
11:07 <martinus\_\_> I think I get it  
11:07 <martinus\_\_> And can I remove older version easily ?  
11:07 <martinus\_\_> Is there an existing script or do I have to write one ?  
11:08 <cjd> it would be a delete from table command, if it's not documented anywhere on xwiki.org you should be able to figure it out from the schema  
11:09 <vmassol> I guess you could empty the xwikiattachment\_archive table bu t I've not done that  
11:09 <cjd> yes, that's what I'd do but always backup the database before doing anything major  
11:09 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/XWikiAttachmentArchive  
11:09 <vmassol> (and http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DatabaseSchema )  
11:10 <martinus\_\_> thanks  
11:25 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: I wouldn't drop the table, just empty it  
11:25 <vmassol> (to be on the safe side)  
11:25 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, yeah, understood  
11:32 <vmassol> more spam coming, sorry… :)  
11:44 <vmassol> release done  
11:46 <cjd> vmassol: is it possible to install a webjar in a subwiki ?  
11:47 <cjd> we're seeing like: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/webjars/codemirror/5.8/lib/codemirror.css  
11:47 <cjd> and in a subwiki the syntax highlighting doesn't work  
11:48 <vmassol> cjd: yes it's possible, see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12884 and http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11571  
11:48 <vmassol> so it depends on your version  
11:49 <vmassol> so short story: starting from 7.1M1 it wasn't possible anymore  
11:49 <vmassol> and it's been fixed  
11:49 <vmassol> in 7.1.4 and 7.4M2+  
11:50 <cjd> ok  
11:51 <cjd> thanks  
12:14 <vmassol> cjd: you muted the boit?  
12:14 <vmassol> \*bot  
12:15 <vmassol> it's been several changes I made to xwiki.org that didn't appear here  
12:15 <vmassol> hmm I don't see any mute command...  
12:15 <vmassol> ah yes you did  
12:15 <ansuz> -q, I think  
12:28 <cjd> I did because it was doing an import-extension-from-maven  
14:01 <vmassol> testing quickly 7.4RC1...  
14:06 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: hi, I think there might be a problem with https://www.evernote.com/l/AHfUJ1B5EBVGNqLRluIibXbMUwfl4dp\_BME  
14:07 <yflory> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <vmassol> mflorea, gdelhumeau, ClemensR: do you agree about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12929 ?  
14:17 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: maybe you could check http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12930 ?  
14:17 <ClemensR> why are there  two Page 3?  
14:18 <vmassol> that's the bug :)  
14:18 <mflorea> translations  
14:19 <vmassol> I don't think that sorting can work fine anyway mflorea  
14:19 <vmassol> right?  
14:19 <ClemensR> h, and disabling the sort would make sure the bug is no longer visible, instead of fixing it?  
14:20 <ClemensR> (I should reproduce this first, before firing questions around)  
14:20 <mflorea> I agree that sorting on the title can be confusing  
14:20 <mflorea> because we display the rendered title and we sort on the raw title  
14:20 <vmassol> BTW I was wondering if we should remove the title column and instead have a single Location column and display the title in there. For example:  "Sandbox / Test Page 1 (Sandbox Test Page 1)"  
14:21 <vmassol> FTR I've done a test with my kid and the first WTF he experienced was when he tried filtering on the title column and there was no input field. He didn't understand why had to use the Location column to do that…  
14:22 <mflorea> then the Location sort/filter will be confusing  
14:23 <vmassol> it would be only on the location not on the title (if the title is displayed in italic or something maybe it would'nt be that confusing - at least users would get some results)  
14:24 <vmassol> or maybe some text to display where the filter should be for the Title column  
14:24 <vmassol> "Use Location column to filter", "Not filterable", ?  
14:25 <vmassol> users don't really get the difference between page name and titles, hence the reason I was thinking about putting them together for now  
14:28 <mflorea> another thing, the location should probably be relative to the parent on the Children viewer. It doesn't make sense to repeat "Sandbox" on each row when you know from the title that these are the children of Sandbox  
14:28 <vmassol> and another one: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12931  
14:28 <mflorea> but then it will complicate the filtering  
14:28 <vmassol> wow in 5 minutes found 4 issues  
14:28 <vmassol> we're missing polishing  
14:29 <vmassol> indeed mflorea  
14:31 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12932 now  
14:35 <vmassol> and http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12933  
14:36 <vmassol> hmm any idea why SandBox.WebHome is at 2.1?  
14:36 <vmassol> in the xml file the version is 1.1  
14:39 <mflorea> my guess is that it has to do with the attachment. I see that XWiki.AdminSheet is also 2.1  
14:39 <mflorea> same for Main.SolrSearch  
14:40 <vmassol> found another regression  
14:41 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12934  
14:43 <mflorea> vmassol: I don't have it  
14:43 <mflorea> what version are you testing on?  
14:43 <mflorea> the menu is fine for me on the history viewer  
14:43 <vmassol> hmm then it's cache  
14:43 <vmassol> checking  
14:43 <mflorea> I remember I've seen issue in the past but I think it was fixed  
14:43 <vmassol> yes it was fixed  
14:44 <vmassol> which is why I was calling this a regression  
14:44 <vmassol> checking my cache  
14:44 <mflorea> I have a 7.4-SNAPSHOT from yesterday  
14:45 <vmassol> not a cahce issue  
14:45 <vmassol> are you sure you're using the edit action?  
14:45 <vmassol> (and not view)  
14:45 <vmassol> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/AdminSheet?editor=history  
14:45 <mflorea> hmm, edit with viewer=history? that doesn't make senses  
14:45 <mflorea> viewer=xyz works with view action afaik  
14:46 <vmassol> what doesn't make sense is what is diqplyed  
14:46 <vmassol> \*displayed  
14:46 <mflorea> edit action has editor param  
14:46 <mflorea> how did you get this URL?  
14:47 <mflorea> the display is broken on my instance also, but I don't think this URL makes sense  
14:47 <vmassol> what doesn't make sens is what is displayed  
14:47 <vmassol> if we don't support this we shouldn't display something wrong  
14:48 <vmassol> right now it's broken  
14:48 <mflorea> you can mix actions with any params, that doesn't mean the result will be ok  
14:48 <vmassol> I was trying to see the history for this page  
14:48 <vmassol> mflorea: I don't agree  
14:48 <vmassol> the param shouldn't have any effect  
14:48 <vmassol> but the page should \*never\* be broken  
14:48 <mflorea> it's a problem if there is some UI that uses this URL  
14:49 <vmassol> no it's a problem even if no UI uses it  
14:49 <vmassol> the proof is that I got to it and found it a bug  
14:49 <vmassol> :)  
14:49 <vmassol> I was just trying to see the history of XWiki.AdminSheet  
14:50 <vmassol> and there's no other way I know of doing that btw :)  
14:50 <mflorea> history is a viewer and viewers work with view action, anyway, even if it's a problem, it's a very small problem  
14:50 <vmassol> yes I didn't say it was a big problem indeed :)  
14:50 <mflorea> you don't edit the history, you view it  
14:50 <vmassol> show me how  
14:50 <vmassol> :)  
14:51 <vmassol> (for that page)  
14:51 <mflorea> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/AdminSheet?viewer=history  
14:51 <vmassol> ah yes my bad  
14:51 <mflorea> :)  
14:51 <vmassol> was using editor=history  
14:52 <vmassol> (wrongly)  
14:52 <mflorea> Main.MailConfig is 2.1 also  
14:52 <vmassol> yes so it seems a general issue  
14:52 <mflorea> I don't think it's a coincidence that all pages with attachments have 2.1  
14:52 <vmassol> wheneere there's an attachment  
14:52 <vmassol> yep  
14:53 <vmassol> added the info to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12933  
14:59 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:59 <vmassol> mflorea: we have a jira issue for the CTRL+G suggest showing translations, right?  
14:59 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <mflorea> yes  
15:00 <vmassol> ok  
15:00 <mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12903  
15:00 <vmassol> thx  
15:00 <vmassol> closed...  
15:00 <vmassol> ah dup  
15:01 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-5791  
15:01 <mflorea> XWIKI-5791  
15:01 <mflorea> is more generic  
15:01 <mflorea> any autosuggest has this issue  
15:01 <mflorea> comes from a bug in the search REST resource  
15:02 <vmassol> ok  
15:03 <vmassol> mflorea: actually I don't have the problem in search autosuggest  
15:03 <mflorea> that's different, it's not autosuggest  
15:03 <mflorea> that is solr search  
15:03 <vmassol> ok that was the example in that issue  
15:04 <mflorea> by autosuggest I mean the sugggestXXX CSS behaviour classes  
15:04 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:04 <vmassol> ok  
15:04 <mflorea> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SpecialCSSClasses#HB2.Behaviorclassnames  
15:05 <mflorea> .suggestDocuments  
15:10 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <msmeria> has quit  
15:14 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:15 <yflory> vmassol: Hi, if you have some time, can you explain to me what is the issue with the POM of Syntax Highlighting?  
15:16 <vmassol> yflory: hi  
15:16 <vmassol> AFAICS you fixed a typo in an existing artifact id, correct?  
15:17 <yflory> It was a typo that I had created in pull request  
15:17 <vmassol> ah ok that's what I was missing  
15:17 <vmassol> then you can discard my commet :)  
15:17 <vmassol> \*comment  
15:18 <yflory> Ok thanks :)  
15:18 <vmassol> thanks for checking  
15:18 <vmassol> and sorry for the noise  
15:23 <vmassol> mflorea: do you think you'll have time to  fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12757 for 7.4 final?  
15:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: are you taking http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12761 for 7.4 final?  
15:24 <mflorea> I'm working on it  
15:24 <vmassol> ok cool  
15:25 <mflorea> I can work on creating pages from the location tree afterwards  
15:25 <vmassol> ok  
15:25 <vmassol> I've moved stuff to 7.4.1+ but if we can do it before it's better ofc ;)  
15:27 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12846# would be nice too for 7.4 final  
15:27 <vmassol> especially since watchlist supports NS now  
15:28 <vmassol> just commented on it  
15:28 <vmassol> maybe gdelhumeau will have time to do it since it's the same as for the other livetable he worked on I thin  
15:28 <vmassol> \*think  
15:28 <vmassol> ?  
15:30 <gdelhumeau> seems ok  
15:30 <vmassol> cool  
15:30 <vmassol> thx  
15:33 <gdelhumeau> I've open:  
15:33 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12937  
15:40 <vmassol> ok  
15:40 <vmassol> right now copy should require only edit + delete  
15:40 <vmassol> (for the page)  
15:41 <vmassol> ah no sorry  
15:41 <vmassol> was thinking about rename  
15:58 <yflory> has quit  
16:01 <Ramona1> has quit  
16:49 <vmassol> mflorea: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9960 :)  
16:49 <mflorea> :)  
16:49 <mflorea> you're getting old :P  
16:49 <vmassol> yep  
16:49 <vmassol> :)  
16:50 <vmassol> or I create too many jira issues ;)  
16:50 <mflorea> that too :)  
16:50 <vmassol> was 2 years ago  
16:52 <vmassol> it's a very old issue actually, I could reproduce on 5.2.4 so it's even older than that  
17:03 <mflorea> has quit  
17:05 <vmassol> not very good: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10352#Created-vs-Resolved-Chart/13643  
17:06 <vmassol> on the last 120 days there were 33 more bugs created than closed  
17:06 <vmassol> on 1 year we're at -99  
17:07 <vmassol> that's not very good for stabilization releases where we should fix on fixing bugs :) I guess NS has pushed us on new stuff vs fixing bugs  
17:07 <vmassol> (on 1600 days we're only at -5)  
17:11 <vmassol> cool that was fast gdelhumeau :)  
17:11 <gdelhumeau> hmm I haven't launch the integration tetss  
17:11 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:11 <vmassol> one thing we need to check also are the FR translations  
17:14 <vmassol> indeed integration tests won't work for sure if you haven't modified them yet :)  
17:15 <gdelhumeau> they pass :/  
17:15 <vmassol> hehe so it means they're not testing much I guess  
17:15 <vmassol> not interacting with the LT  
17:15 <gdelhumeau> or they are in xwiki-enterprise  
17:23 <ClemensR> I cannot create a new "version" for  http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/MOCCACAL  in the jira ... just in case I wanted to make a release. I guess I should ask the official "project lead" for that ?  
17:24 <vmassol> you're not the lead of that project ClemensR?  
17:24 <vmassol> I think you should be, WDYT?  
17:25 <ClemensR> I asked to get our Denis hre be the lead of the project, hope he would keep on contributing ...  seems that strategy didnt work, however ;)  
17:25 <vmassol> ok adding you then  
17:25 <vmassol> done  
17:25 <vmassol> :)  
17:25 <ClemensR> ok, thanks a lot !  
17:26 <vmassol> you had 2 accounts  
17:26 <vmassol> I picked the one with an avatar  
17:26 <vmassol> note that Denis has an admin role on that project too  
17:26 <vmassol> (haven't changed this)  
17:30 <ClemensR> I guess the one w/o avatar is the one imported from github. My account naming is highly inconsistent, unfortunately. Didnt real all the best practices before starting to contribute. ;)  
17:31 <vmassol> :)  
17:39 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I think you should modify the version of xwiki-enterprise to 8.0-SNAPSHOT  
17:39 <vmassol> hmm the release script should have done it, checking  
17:39 <vmassol> thanks  
17:43 <vmassol> thanks, I thought the release scripts were doing it now  
17:44 <vmassol> should be ok now gdelhumeau, thanks  
17:45 <vmassol> hmm I need to create the jobs for 7.4.x too  
17:45 <vmassol> doing that now  
17:50 <vmassol> done  
18:07 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
18:20 <ClemensR> has quit  
18:27 <Denis> has quit

18:33 <gdelhumeau> ?  
18:34 <vmassol> +1  
18:34 <vmassol> maybe  
18:34 <vmassol> update the page name + title  
18:35 <vmassol> with OW2Con 15 in the page name/title  
18:35 <vmassol> (gdelhumeau)  
18:35 <gdelhumeau> ok  
18:35 <vmassol> as otherwise the current page name/title is very generic  
18:35 <vmassol> and in the future we'll have more on this topic  
18:35 <vmassol> at different events  
18:36 <vmassol> OW2con'15: The XWiki product and its community  
18:36 <vmassol> ?  
18:39 <vmassol> https://www.dokuwiki.org/dokuwiki# is really fast and easy to read compared to our xwiki.org IMO  
18:40 <gdelhumeau> not very fancy  
18:41 <vmassol> it's several times faster and easier to navigate IMO don't you think?  
19:27 <gdelhumeau> oh yes fast for sure  
19:29 <vmassol> and easier to navigate too IMO
